definitions.definition: A varying measure of capacity , usually being a quarter of a barrel ; specifically, a measure equal to nine imperial gallons .
A small wooden vessel or cask of indeterminate size, used for butter, lard, etc.
A measurement for the mass of butter, equalling 56 pounds.

main_definition: ( British ) A varying measure of capacity , usually being a quarter of a barrel ; specifically, a measure equal to nine imperial gallons .
secondary_definitions: ( US ) A small wooden vessel or cask of indeterminate size, used for butter, lard, etc.
A measurement for the mass of butter, equalling 56 pounds.
